CADI.Common.Cache

Class PrecinctDataBin

  • java.lang.Object
    • CADI.Common.Cache.DataBin
      • CADI.Common.Cache.PrecinctDataBin
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ClassIdentifiers

    public class PrecinctDataBin
extends DataBin
    Extends the DataBin class to support precinct-based data bins.

    Further information, see ISO/IEC 15444-9 section A.2

    Version:
    1.1.7 2012/03/12
    Author:
    Group on Interactive Coding of Images (GICI)

    • Field Detail

      • inClassIdentifier

        private long inClassIdentifier
        Definition in JPIPMessageHeader.inClassIdentifier

      • dataStream

        private DataBinStream dataStream
        Object containing the stream of data.

      • numCompletedPackets

        private java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> numCompletedPackets
        An array list which indicates the last full layer achieved with the data stored in the dataBin array list. A value of 0 indicates that either there is not data saved for this precinct or the server does not signal the layer which data belongs (i.e. Aux parameter in jpip message header has not been used).

        Definition in JPIPMessageHeader.Aux

      • lengths

        private java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> lengths
        Records the cumulated lengths of the completed packets.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PrecinctDataBin

        Constructor.
        Parameters:
        inClassIdentifier - definition in inClassIdentifier.

      • PrecinctDataBin

        public PrecinctDataBin(long inClassIdentifier,
               int numLayers)
        Constructor.

        Passing the number of layers allows a capacity initialization of the stream used to store precinct data bin. Then, performance is improved.

        Parameters:
        inClassIdentifier - definition in inClassIdentifier.
        numLayers -

    • Method Detail

      • getInClasIdentifier

        public long getInClasIdentifier()
        Returns the inClassIdentifier attribute.
        Returns:
        the inClassIdentifier attribute.

      • addStream

        public void addStream(byte[] data,
             long offset,
             boolean complete,
             int numCompletedPackets)
        Adds a precinct data-bin message to the cache.

        This method can only be used when there were no gaps between consecutive message data. Otherwise, and exception is thrown.

        Parameters:
        data - definition in JPIPMessage.messageBody
        offset - definition in JPIPMessageHeader.msgOffset
        complete - definition in JPIPMessageHeader.isLastByte
        numCompletedPackets - the last full layer (if this information is provived). Otherwise, it is 0.

      • getNumCompletePackets

        public int getNumCompletePackets()
        Returns the number of completed packets.

        Returned value could not be the actual number of completed packets because it is updated using the JPIP message's auxiliary information. Then, only when the server sends this information is this value updated correctly.

        Returns:
        number of completed packets.

      • isPacketCompleted

        public boolean isPacketCompleted(int layer)
        Returns true if the packet layer is enterely in the cache. layer values are from 1 to max. number of layers.
        Parameters:
        layer - number of the packet/layer.
        Returns:
        true if it is cached. Otherwise, returns false

      • getLastCompleteLayer

        public int getLastCompleteLayer(long dataBinLength)
        Returns the last completed layer achieved at the byte dataBinLength .
        Parameters:
        dataBinLength -
        Returns:
        the last completed layer.

      • getLastCompleteLayerNew

        public int getLastCompleteLayerNew(long dataBinLength)

      • getPacketLength

        public int getPacketLength(int layer)
        Returns the length of the packet layer. layer values are from 1 to max. number of layers.
        Parameters:
        layer - is the packet/layer in the precinct stream.
        Returns:
        length of the packet/layer.

      • getPacketOffset

        public int getPacketOffset(int layer)
        Returns the offset in the data bin of the packet layer. layer values are from 1 to max. number of layers.
        Parameters:
        layer - is the packet/layer in the precinct stream.
        Returns:
        offset of the packet/layer in the precinct stream.
